summary: The document, part of the John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992, details an FBI record about a 1977 attack on an embassy attaché's house in Lima, Peru. This incident was not widely known or publicly disclosed. While the American Embassy in Lima did not report the attack, detailed reports were sent to Washington by the Lima station and the Defense Attaché's Office. The document also touches on the involvement of revolutionary organizations and neutrality issues between Cuba and Peru.
key_findings: The document pertains to an undisclosed attack in Lima, Peru, in 1977.
Reports of the attack were submitted to headquarters in Washington by the station in Lima and the Defense Attaché's Office, but not by the American Embassy in Lima.
The document involves revolutionary organizations and discusses neutrality matters related to Cuba and Peru.
It is part of the JFK Assassination Records Act, indicating its relevance to broader investigations or records concerning the assassination.
